intro: Leptocereus, commonly known as the night-blooming cereus, is a genus of cacti native to the Americas. These plants are characterized by their spiny stems and nocturnal flowering habits, with flowers opening at night. They typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments and are well adapted to drought conditions. The flowers are usually white or pale in color and have a strong, sweet fragrance. Leptocereus species are popular among cactus enthusiasts for their striking appearance and unique blooming behavior.
